remarks: If a set ` A ` is equinumerous to the successor of a natural number ` M ` , then ` A ` with an element removed is equinumerous to ` M ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Aug-2015.)
statement: dif1en $p |- ( ( M e. _om /\ A ~~ suc M /\ X e. A ) -> ( A \ { X } ) ~~ M ) $.
